Posts.Content: On May 08, 2011 12:32 PM nelia wrote: I've been on Aromasin for almost 6 month and only in the last two weeks I am starting to feel pain in my joints. Especially in the morning when I get up. Is there anything that may help? Yoga? Also in the last two weeks I noticed that my hair got very thin...I always had a lot and strong hair, but I must have lost half of my hair in the front...and this in two weeks time. In the back they still feel OK. Are those side effects getting worse? Does the hair grow back? I could tolerate being bold through the chemo, but now loosing all this hair again is difficult to cope with. Anybody out there having some answers? In January 2009, I was put on Femara by my oncologist after 6 rounds of chemo and radiation for stage 2 breast cancer.  By the summer of 2009, I had difficulty walking with severe pain in my knees and hips.  With his suggestion, I stopped the Femara and stayed off it for 6 weeks.  My joint pain did subside, but he told me I had to go on another cancer maintenance drug because my breast cancer was estrogen positive.  I have been on Aromasin since early September, 2010 and my joint pain is not as bad as when I was on the Femara.  It has not gone away completely, but it is so much better then while I was on the Femara.  I intend to stay on Aromasin.  I do still ache when I get  up in the morning, but I find that exercising, by walking or using my stationary bike does help.  You mentioned your hair thinning and I have noticed mine is thinner also, but I use a volumizing mousse and that does make my hair seem a little thicker.  I am hanging in there with the Aromisin only because my joint pain is not as bad.  I guess I can deal with the hair problem for awhile.  I was diagnosed in March 2008, so I have to be on the maintenance drug for a few more years! Let's hang in there.
